educations.schoolName: University of Southern California - Sol Price School of Public Policy

headline: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: Highly-motivated, personable and creative management professional with extensive congressional experience. Efficient communicator with exceptional time management, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Acknowledged throughout career for demonstrating rational decision making: weighing facts and parlaying the most pertinent information and follow-up accordingly. Exemplary ability to distill the most effective course of action in response to large scale crisis, negative publicity, and languishing internal/external communication protocols. Employs astute relationship building skills that foster teamwork and cooperation at all levels and with key external stakeholders. Core competencies include Public Reputation Management, Member & Congress Relations, Strategic & Tactical Planning, Marketing Campaigns, Research & Reporting, Policies & Procedures, Media Spokesperson, Public & Media Relations, Special Event Coordination, Corporate Correspondence, Legal & Legislative Affairs, Press Release, Content Writing, print and broadcast media

positions.companyName: U.S. House of Representatives - Chief Adminstrative Officer
positions.description:
â¢	Manage the Congressman's portfolio on the following issue areas: financial services, defense, veterans, and public land management. 

â¢	Maintain a strong working relationship with Nevada state legislators, county and city officials.

â¢	Work with government agencies, private businesses and non-profit organizations to provide informational resources for constituents.

â¢	Attend and speaks on behalf of the Congressman at ribbon cutting ceremonies, conventions, business expos, round table meetings and other community events.

â¢	Serve as a liaison between constituents and government agencies to assist in disputes.

â¢	Write communications on behalf of the Congressman to provide legislative and district updates for constituents. 

â¢	Assists in managing constituent outreach duties.
positions.title: District Representative - Congressman Ruben Kihuen

positions.description:
â¢	Acted as the representative for the Congressman within his or her area of responsibility including answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, verbal communications with 
constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies.

â¢	Informed the Congressman and the District Director of all happenings in his or her assigned issue areas by screening district media sources and interacting with constituents.

â¢	Acted as a liaison to local, state and federal officials and other persons or groups to form effective relationships for the Congressman.

â¢	Assessed casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff/Administrative Assistant.

â¢	Monitored scheduled district meetings for the Congressman with constituents.

â¢	Trained and supervised Staff Assistants, including interns, to handle office matters such as logging incoming and outgoing correspondence, handling visitors, telephone calls, and computer operations.

â¢	Prepared periodic reports for the District Director on pending cases and district activities in his or her assigned issue areas.

â¢	Screened active cases and acts as liaison with constituents to ensure that their cases are handled in a responsive manner.
â¢	Maintained up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information of importance to the office.
positions.title: District Representative - Congressman Cresent Hardy

positions.description:
+ Mentored and developed twelve team members readiness for combat operations, conducted assessments on individual members, and provided in depth counseling on performance to individual team members.

+ Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team to produce monthly training requirements for over 40 personnel, monitoring and ensuring each individual meets guidelines established by military commanders.

+ Supervised and coordinated the preparation of personnel, weapons, and equipment for training for twelve team members with 100% accountability.

+ RSO (Range Safety Officer)
positions.title: Infantry Squad Leader

positions.description:
+ Served as key coordinator regarding the administration of unit and
individual training, interpreting training directives and guidance and
analyzing unit training status

+ Reviewed incoming directives, policies, and instructions from higher
headquarters, advising the commander, developing, and then
recommending appropriate action to implement changes.

+ Coordinated unit participation in public events, e.g., parades, projects,
and displays. 

+ Updating databases with confidential and relevant information.

+ Ensuring office expenditure is maintained within budgeted levels.

+ Writing up simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.

+ Managed a living facility compromised of seventy-two rooms with
one-hundred and fifty occupants, ensuring key controls, processing
maintenance request, and conducting weekly inspections to ensure
repairs were accomplished.
positions.title: Grounds Operation Specialist

positions.description:
+ Assisted the senior leadership with the planning and execution of 30 raids during combat operations in Iraq. 

+ Conducted over 200 combat patrols providing local security and intelligence gathering.

+ Trained over 50 Iraq soldiers in small arms weapons and handling, which lead to a 90% overall increase in situational awareness and marksmanship.
positions.title: Team Leader
